intro: Afrosison djurense, commonly known as the Cape dune lily, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tall flower spikes that can reach up to 1.5 meters in height. The plant thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal dune environments. Its flowers, which bloom in late winter to early spring, are typically blue or purple in color. Afrosison djurense is adapted to withstand harsh coastal conditions, including strong winds and salt spray.
